extendedInfo.description: The Callcentric Android app allows existing Callcentric customers to place calls worldwide using their Callcentric account and save significant money over cellular carrier calling rates. This is particularly useful to customers who want to save money on international calls, or want the caller ID of their Callcentric account to show up on outbound calls they place instead of their Android phone number.Just download the app and configure your Android phone number, Callcentric username and password, and you're ready to start calling. When you place a call from the app you will first receive a callback to your regular Android phone number, and when you answer your Android you will be connected to the party you dialed.â¢ Traveling overseas?In many places around the world you can obtain a local SIM card either for your un-locked Android or a pre-paid and cheap GSM mobile phone. In many countries inbound calls to your mobile number are free, and by combining this with the Callcentric app you can place calls back home or worldwide for much lower rates than roaming with your phone, placing calls from your hotel, or even using a locally obtained SIM card.â¢ Use it from other phones!You can even set a different phone number than your Android phone number in the Callcentric app, and the number you enter will be called first to initiate your call. For example, perhaps you're staying at a friends house and want to place a call that doesn't get charged to their phone? Simply enter the phone number of your friends home phone in the app, and you can initiate a call that will first ring your friends phone, and then when you answer connect you to the party you want to call, all without your friend receiving any charges on their bill.â¢ Even call Callcentric 1777xxxxxxx numbers!Using the Callcentric app you can call any other Callcentric customers 1777xxxxxxx number, even if they don't have a "real" phone number. You can also place calls to other VoIP networks using Callcentric and SIP Broker.â¢ See your Callcentric account balance anytimeYour Callcentric account balance is always shown within the Callcentric Android app.â¢ Dial as you wishYou can dial manually from the keypad, from your recent call history, or by using the contacts on your Android.â¢ Want to use Callcentric directly over VoIP from your Android?There are many 3rd party apps available for the Android that will allow you to use your Callcentric account over Wi-Fi or 3G data and place calls using VoIP softphones.â¢ A note about charges:Please note that regular data charges may apply if using the Callcentric app over a cellular data network (2G / 3G), and regular call charges will be applied by your cellular carrier for receiving inbound calls to your Android or the number you enter as "My Number" in your settings. Calls placed from the Callcentric Android app will incur 2 charges on your Callcentric account: 1 for the call to your Android or number you enter as "My Number", and the 2nd for the call placed to the person you are calling, both at standard Callcentric rates.â¢ Note to Verizon / Sprint / CDMA network based Android customers:The Callcentric Android app uses data to communicate with the Callcentric network. CDMA networks (Verizon/Sprint in the USA) don't support using data (2G / 3G) and voice simultaneously unless you are connected to a Wi-Fi network. Because of this, CDMA Android customers may have difficulty using the Callcentric app, especially if you are using it while not connected to Wi-Fi AND while in a 2G (1XRTT) data coverage area.

reviews.title: misbegotten pre-VOIP design
reviews.comment: what a wasted opportunity.  this is just a generic softphone dialer with some dial-back functionality for people whose VOIP usage orbits around their cellular account.  what i would have wanted to see out of a \"CallCentric App\" would have been GUI\'ed Android access to my CC vmail, call history and settings as well as vanilla dialing.  the \"history\" only shows the calls seen by the app while running; NOT the call activity seen by the DID.  the architect seems stuck in the 1990\'s cell carrier mindset: the internet is just some pimple on a cell-phone.  this GalNote owner sees his Android device as a pocketable internet device that can connect over a cellular carrier, as well as wifi, and that allows voice communication as value-added.  this \"app\" shows all the design creativity of a \"Call-Centric complimentary grocery tote-bag\".  it\'s a good thing that it\'s free, although it\'s still overpriced.
reviews.author: Steve Barton

reviews.comment: Good for America (with our often national-only mobile calling plans)

reviews.title: Not enough
reviews.comment: Needs more features to justify having this app on my phone. Needs voicemail access, call logs, settings page to modify call handling rules, etc.

reviews.comment: Works with no problem and save so much money for international calls. Love it!

reviews.title: You guys don\'t understand!
reviews.comment: ...it\'s an app for people with a Callcentric account and uses their click2call callback feature so that if you have an mobile phone plan with free incoming minutes then you save your prime minutes and get Callcentric calling card rates.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Works exactly as described.
reviews.comment: The title says it all.  Works great when combined with an unlimited incoming plan, especially while roaming or for long distance calls.  I would imagine the same for a My5 or similar plan.  Just a note that this is not a Sip client.  IMHO, it\'s better than a SIP client in that I can have (slightly more expensive, yet) high quality calls when all I have is 3G or Edge.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Works amazing
reviews.comment: This is NOT a SIP/softphone. If you want that it\'s already integrated into android 2.5+.  This app integrates with android and can be a full dailer replacement allowing seamless callbacks from your contacts list, text messages etc. This allows people with unlimited incoming calls to place outgoing calls without using cell minutes. This works amazing when you are in places that don\'t have a strong enough data connection to simply place a SIP call because you use your carriers voice network (rather then their
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: People are confused. Deserves higher rating.
reviews.comment: This is the Click2Call app (why didn\'t they just call it that?)   In the settings be sure to enter your *callback number* in the phone number field, NOT your Callcentric number. People complaining it\'s not a VoIP app are confused... It\'s not supposed to be! Android has a built-in SIP client that works with the service if that\'s what you want!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Perfect!  Now I can call clients from cell and they know its me and they don\'t get my real cell number.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good idea!
reviews.comment: Does what it\'s supposed to do.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: A fantastic app for travel.

reviews.title: Not a voip app
reviews.comment: Just a callback tool that connects you over your regular cell airtime.

reviews.title: At Last. Excellent app! Works great on SG Note
reviews.comment: Saving $ now on foreign trips. Very convenient. Surprised by bad ratings & misunderstanding of app. Guys, this is not a SIP softphone and you must be a Callcentric user for app to work.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Does not work on tablets
reviews.comment: Callcentric is a great VoIP service.  I am a long time happy customer, but unfortunately this  is not a true VOIP client.  Will not work on tablets.
reviews.author: A Google User
